i.title: Index
i.description: Line number inside the list of charges (calculated).

key.title: Key
key.description:
Key for grouping or identifying charges for tax purposes. A suggested list of
keys is provided, but these may be extended by the issuer.

code.title: Code
code.description: Code to used to refer to the this charge by the issuer

reason.title: Reason
reason.description: Text description as to why the charge was applied

base.title: Base
base.description:
Base represents the value used as a base for percent calculations instead
of the invoice's sum of lines.

percent.title: Percent
percent.description: Percentage to apply to the sum of all lines

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: Amount to apply (calculated if percent present)

taxes.title: Taxes
taxes.description: List of taxes to apply to the charge

ext.title: Extensions
ext.description: Extension codes that apply to the charge

Charge.description: Charge represents a surchange applied to the complete document independent from the individual lines.

receiver.title: Receiver
receiver.description: The party who will receive delivery of the goods defined in the invoice and is not responsible for taxes.

identities.title: Identities
identities.description:
Identities is used to define specific codes or IDs that may be used to
identify the delivery.

date.title: Date
date.description: When the goods should be expected.

period.title: Period
period.description: Period of time in which to expect delivery if a specific date is not available.

DeliveryDetails.description: DeliveryDetails covers the details of the destination for the products described in the invoice body.

i.title: Index
i.description: Line number inside the list of discounts (calculated)

anyOf.title: Bonus for works ahead of schedule

key.title: Key
key.description: Key for identifying the type of discount being applied.

code.title: Code
code.description: Code to used to refer to the this discount by the issuer

reason.title: Reason
reason.description: Text description as to why the discount was applied

base.title: Base
base.description:
Base represents the value used as a base for percent calculations instead
of the invoice's sum of lines.

percent.title: Percent
percent.description: Percentage to apply to the base or invoice's sum.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: Amount to apply (calculated if percent present).

taxes.title: Taxes
taxes.description: List of taxes to apply to the discount

ext.title: Extensions
ext.description: Extension codes that apply to the discount

Discount.description: Discount represents an allowance applied to the complete document independent from the individual lines.

$addons.title: Addons
$addons.description:
Addons defines a list of keys used to identify tax addons that apply special
normalization, scenarios, and validation rules to a document.

$tags.title: Tags
$tags.description:
Tags are used to help identify specific tax scenarios or requirements that will
apply changes to the contents of the invoice. Tags by design should always be optional,
it should always be possible to build a valid invoice without any tags.

oneOf.title: Purchase Order
oneOf.description: A purchase order is a document that a buyer sends to a seller to request goods or services.

oneOf.title: Sales Order
oneOf.description: A sales order is a document that a seller sends to a buyer to confirm the sale of goods or services.

oneOf.title: Quote
oneOf.description: A quote is a document that a seller sends to a buyer to provide a price for goods or services.

series.title: Series
series.description: Used as a prefix to group codes.

code.title: Code
code.description: Sequential code used to identify this invoice in tax declarations.

op_date.title: Operation Date
op_date.description: Date when the operation defined by the invoice became effective.

value_date.title: Value Date
value_date.description: When the taxes of this invoice become accountable, if none set, the issue date is used.

exchange_rates.title: Exchange Rates
exchange_rates.description: Exchange rates to be used when converting the invoices monetary values into other currencies.

preceding.title: Preceding Details
preceding.description: Key information regarding previous order documents.

identities.title: Identities
identities.description: Additional codes, IDs, SKUs, or other regional or custom identifiers that may be used to identify the order.

period.title: Period
period.description: Period of time in which the order is valid.

supplier.title: Supplier
supplier.description: The entity supplying the goods or services and usually responsible for paying taxes.

customer.title: Customer
customer.description: Legal entity receiving the goods or services, may be nil in certain circumstances such as simplified invoices.

buyer.title: Buyer
buyer.description: Party who is responsible for issuing payment, if not the same as the customer.

seller.title: Seller
seller.description: Seller is the party liable to pay taxes on the transaction if not the same as the supplier.

lines.title: Lines
lines.description: List of lines representing each of the items to be ordered.

discounts.title: Discounts
discounts.description: Discounts or allowances applied to order totals

charges.title: Charges
charges.description: Charges or surcharges applied to order totals

payment.title: Payment Details
payment.description: Information on when, how, and to whom a final invoice would be paid.

delivery.title: Delivery Details
delivery.description: Specific details on delivery of the goods to copy to the final invoice.

totals.title: Totals
totals.description: Summary of all the order totals, including taxes (calculated).

notes.title: Notes
notes.description:
Unstructured information that is relevant to the order, such as correction or additional
legal details.

complements.title: Complements
complements.description: Additional complementary objects that add relevant information to the order.

meta.title: Meta
meta.description: Additional semi-structured data that doesn't fit into the body of the order.

attachments.title: Attachments
attachments.description:
Attachments provide additional information or supporting documents that are not included
in the main document. It is important that attachments are not used for alternative
versions of the PDF, for that, see "links" inside the envelope headers.

Order.description: Order documents are used for the initial part of a order-to-invoice process where the buyer requests goods or services from the seller.

payee.title: Payee
payee.description: The party responsible for receiving payment of the invoice, if not the supplier.

advances.title: Advances
advances.description: Any amounts that have been paid in advance and should be deducted from the amount due.

instructions.title: Instructions
instructions.description: Details on how payment should be made.

PaymentDetails.description: PaymentDetails contains details as to how the invoice should be paid.

prices_include.title: Prices Include
prices_include.description:
Category of the tax already included in the line item prices, especially
useful for B2C retailers with customers who prefer final prices inclusive of
tax.

oneOf.title: Precise
oneOf.description:
The default method of calculating the totals in GOBL, and provides the best results
for most cases as the precision is maintained to the maximum amount possible. The
tradeoff however is that sometimes the totals may not sum exactly based on what is visible.

oneOf.title: Currency
oneOf.description:
The alternative method of calculating the totals that will first round all the amounts
to the currency's precision before making the sums. Totals using this approach can always
be recalculated using the amounts presented, but can lead to rounding errors in the case
of pre-payments and when line item prices include tax.

rounding.title: Rounding Model
rounding.description:
Rounding model used to perform tax calculations on the invoice. This
will be configured automatically based on the tax regime, or
`sum-then-round` by default, but you can override here if needed.
Use with caution, as some conversion tools may make assumptions about
the rounding model used.

ext.title: Extensions
ext.description:
Additional extensions that are applied to the invoice as a whole as opposed to specific
sections.

meta.title: Meta
meta.description:
Any additional data that may be required for processing, but should never
be relied upon by recipients.

Tax.description: Tax defines a summary of the taxes which may be applied to an invoice.

sum.title: Sum
sum.description: Sum of all line item sums

discount.title: Discount
discount.description: Sum of all document level discounts

charge.title: Charge
charge.description: Sum of all document level charges

tax_included.title: Tax Included
tax_included.description: If prices include tax, this is the total tax included in the price.

total.title: Total
total.description: Sum of all line sums minus the discounts, plus the charges, without tax.

taxes.title: Tax Totals
taxes.description: Summary of all the taxes included in the invoice.

tax.title: Tax
tax.description: Total amount of tax to apply to the invoice.

total_with_tax.title: Total with Tax
total_with_tax.description: Grand total after all taxes have been applied.

rounding.title: Rounding
rounding.description:
Rounding amount to apply to the invoice in case the total and payable
amounts don't quite match.

payable.title: Payable
payable.description: Total amount to be paid after applying taxes and outlays.

advance.title: Advance
advance.description: Total amount already paid in advance.

due.title: Due
due.description: How much actually needs to be paid now.

Totals.description: Totals contains the summaries of all calculations for the invoice.
